programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Everything is coming up roses on Martha's Bedford farm; join Martha while she creates new garden with almost 200 roses.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Welcome to Martha's woodland gardens. Martha's azalea grove is bursting with the last flowers of spring. Everything you need to know about hostas. Martha takes up bird watching.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.sub-title: Martha's Amazing Maze and How to Grow Trees From Seedlings
programme.desc: Welcome to Martha's passion project: the maze on her Bedford farm. Learn how to properly plant trees including measuring, fertilizing, and watering. Plus, how to start trees from seedlings.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.sub-title: Everything You Need To Know About Conifers
programme.desc: Martha celebrates all things conifers, the cone-bearing trees that are typically evergreens. Go inside the Christmas tree farm on her Bedford farm and learn how to properly move an established tree.

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha presents how to make bread pudding, chocolate pots de creme (an old-fashioned French custard), traditional steamed cranberry pudding, and light lemon pudding cakes

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha demystifies the techniques and recipes for four of her favorite French confections: colorful French macarons, Paris-Brest, madeleines, and Breton butter cake

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shares cracker recipes that are easy to make and bake: Julie's flatbread, blue cheese-pecan icebox crackers, thyme crackers, and cheddar bites

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shares four of her favorite home-style cakes, perfect for entertaining or every day: lemon Bundt cake, devil's Bundt cake, whipped cream cake, and applesauce spice cake

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha's all-time favorite desserts are made with nuts. Learn how to use nuts to make: Linzer torte, peanut butter sandwich cookies, St. Andre cake, and pecan tart

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shows how alcohol adds flavor to four longtime favorite desserts: Mrs. Maus' fruitcake, plum-and-port crostata, rum raisin pie, and tiramisu

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Pizza, pretzels, and strudel all involve "pulling" dough. Follow along with Martha and her expert guests to learn more: Lina Kulchinsky, Nick Malgieri, Christian Petroni

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha makes three easy, classic sauces: hollandaise, bechamel, beurre blanc, and marinara

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Eat your vegetables! Martha prepares: spring peas with mint, brown-sugared carrots, sauteed broccoli rabe, roasted acorn squash, corn on the cob, and lemony kale salad

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha shares techniques for three homemade stocks: chicken (including a pressure-cooker version), beef, and vegetable. Plus, cooking and storage tips

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Butcher Evan Lobel joins Martha for a master class on meat. Learn how to choose and prepare the best cuts of meat to save you money

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Starting with a perfect pot of fluffy white rice, Martha demonstrates her techniques for a flavorful pilaf and a delicious Thai-style fried rice

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Homemade dressings don't compare to store-bought. Martha shows you how easy it is to make your own: vinaigrette, creamy blue cheese dressing, homemade mayonnaise, and aioli

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Steaming is one of the fastest and healthiest ways to cook. Martha shows how to cook in parchment paper, clean and steam mussels, and use a bamboo steamer to prepare salmon and peas

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Roasting is an adaptable technique that works well for meat, fish, chicken, and vegetables. Martha prepares roast chicken, beef tenderloin, and autumn vegetable salad

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Meet Martha's chickens! Now with over 200 chickens and 20 different breeds, Martha shares her vast knowledge about raising and caring for her flock. Then learn the how-tos of building the a coop.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.sub-title: Martha Builds a Raised Bed Vegetable Garden
programme.desc: Martha builds a brand new, half-acre raised bed vegetable garden on her farm! It's a step-by-step guide to designing, building, preparing the soil, and planting.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.sub-title: One Pot Wonders With Jamie Oliver
programme.desc: Martha is in the test kitchen with English chef, restaurateur, and author Jamie Oliver, and they're cooking up a mouth-watering menu of dishes that are easy to make.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha and her niece Sophie visit their favorite tea shop, Arogya, in Westport, Conn., to discover the do's and don'ts of making tea; they return to Martha's kitchen to create dishes with tea.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha visits Mast Market in Mt. Kisco, N.Y., and learns the art behind making their renowned chocolate; from roasting cacao, to stone grinding, to forming delicious bars and chips.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha shares techniques for making the perfect burgers; Pat LaFrieda joins Martha to grind his beef mix; Thomas Joseph joins to make a hake fish burger and Martha shares her turkey burger.

programme.sub-title: Martha Throws an Argentine Asado BBQ

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha shares her love of houseplants and brings the outdoors into her home. Learn all about the most popular and sought after houseplants, topiaries and begonias and how to take care of them.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Succulents are known for their vibrant colors, interesting textures, and often beautiful blooms. Martha explores how best to care for succulents including watering, fertilizing, and repotting.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.sub-title: Inside Martha's Vegetable Greenhouse; Seed Starting
programme.desc: Martha takes us inside her vegetable greenhouse to see how she has turned her harvest into a year-round bounty. Then, how she collects, stores, and sows seeds. Plus Martha makes her perfect green drink.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Martha visits the incredible Orchid Show at the New York Botanical Garden. This year's show immerses you in a mesmerizing array of orchids designed by acclaimed artist Lily Kwong.
